summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the drafting and review of a letter to the trustees/counsel of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The correspondence focuses on obtaining a position on attorney-client privilege waiver to aid in discovery review and production.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email on July 23, 2020, who drafted a letter to Epstein's estate trustees regarding discovery issues and attorney-client privilege.

events.title: Draft Letter to Epstein Estate Trustees
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney drafts a letter to the executors/trustees of Jeffrey Epstein's estate regarding discovery issues and seeking their position on attorney-client privilege waiver.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Email Review of Draft Letter
events.description: Multiple email exchanges occur among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel reviewing and editing the draft letter to Epstein's estate trustees, with final approval to send.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively corresponding about contacting Epstein's estate trustees as of July 2020.
A key issue discussed was seeking the estate's position on waiver of attorney-client privilege to assist with discovery review and production.
The estate trustees are also identified as the co-trustees of the '1953 Trust Agreement'.
The document shows ongoing post-conviction/death legal proceedings and evidence collection related to Jeffrey Epstein.
